macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Global stocks end week at or near record highs ahead of key US inflation data
items.summary: Major equity benchmarks closed the prior week with gains: the S&P 500 finished at a record closing high of about 6,966, up roughly 1.8% year-to-date, while US indices broadly ended Friday higher as tech leadership continued and investors weighed softer hiring data and returning US government statistics ahead of a key CPI release that could shape expectations for further Federal Reserve easing.

items.title: FTSE 100 closes at new record high above 10,100 on commodity and large-cap strength
items.summary: The FTSE 100 ended the week at a record high, rising about 0.8% to close near 10,124.6, driven in part by gains in Glencore and supported by strength in precious metals, with gold up about 4% on the week and silver up roughly 9% as investors reacted to signs of a slowdown in the US labor market.

items.title: US stocks log weekly gains as tech leads and big banks set to kick off Q4 earnings season
items.summary: US equities finished Friday higher, with technology names leading and all major indexes posting gains for the first full trading week of 2026, as attention shifts to the start of fourth-quarter earnings from large US banks and key inflation data that could influence the trajectory of Federal Reserve rate cuts.

items.title: Calm trading expected as global markets pause with exchanges closed and investors eye US CPI
items.summary: With major exchanges largely closed, the latest 24 hours have been quiet in terms of new macro and price action, and commentators flag that markets are in a "calm before the storm" phase with limited fresh drivers as investors prepare for US December CPI and the opening stretch of the new earnings season that could significantly reset interest-rate and equity-market expectations.

items.title: Fed outlook: markets brace for CPI print after three consecutive 2025 rate cuts
items.summary: Commentary ahead of the week notes that the Federal Reserve cut rates at each of its last three meetings in 2025 in response to a weakening labor market, and that the upcoming December CPI report will be one of the final key inputs before the late-January FOMC meeting, with any upside surprise potentially curbing expectations for the scale of further easing in 2026.

items.title: Macro backdrop: US labor market softens modestly while equities hit all-time highs
items.summary: A recent macro review notes that initial US unemployment claims have ticked higher while remaining at levels historically associated with growth, mortgage rates hover just above 6%, and demand for goods and services remains positive; against this backdrop, the S&P 500 has reached fresh all-time highs and is up nearly 2% so far this year.

items.title: Week-ahead preview: US banks and Asian tech to anchor early-2026 earnings season
items.summary: Market strategists highlight that the coming days will see the first major earnings reports of the year, led by large US banks and key Asian technology companies, with consensus expecting strong year-on-year profit growth for S&P 500 firms in 2025 and further acceleration projected for 2026, leaving equities sensitive to any disappointment or guidance changes.

items.title: Indian IT earnings (TCS, HCL Tech) and China data set early tone for Asian markets
items.summary: Ahead-looking commentary notes that with a quiet news calendar over the past day, early focus in Asia is on the latest results from Indian IT majors such as TCS and HCL Technologies, alongside Chinese industrial demand indicators, which are expected to shape the opening sentiment for regional equities in the next trading session.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin trades flat around $90.7K as total crypto market cap holds near $3.1T
items.summary: Over the past 24 hours Bitcoin has traded in a tight range between about $90,404 and $90,850, up roughly 0.1%, while the total cryptocurrency market capitalization is around $3.1 trillion with mixed performance across major altcoins.

items.title: Ethereum, BNB and major altcoins see modest gains amid sideways market
items.summary: In the last day Ethereum is trading near $3,106 (+0.47%), BNB around $915 (+1.58%), and other large-cap coins like SOL, TRX, DOGE, ADA, and BCH are posting small single‑digit percentage moves, reflecting a generally stable but slightly positive altcoin environment.

items.title: Select tokens HYPER, 币安人生 and BIFI lead market with double‑digit daily gains
items.summary: Among notable outperformers in the past 24 hours, HYPER, 币安人生 and BIFI have surged approximately 25%, 21% and 16% respectively, standing out against mostly muted moves in the broader crypto market.

items.title: Analyst projects potential 60% Bitcoin drawdown as 2026 bear‑market thesis gains attention
items.summary: In a widely discussed interview, Valkyrie’s Steven McClurg argues the four‑year Bitcoin cycle remains intact and says high energy costs forced miners to sell earlier than expected, outlining a bear case where BTC could fall about 60% below its October all‑time high as crypto moves deeper into a potential bear market.

items.title: Commentary questions Bitcoin’s ‘digital gold’ status amid underperformance of BTC treasury firms
items.summary: A new Kitco opinion piece critiques the narrative of Bitcoin as 'digital gold', noting that many Bitcoin treasury companies are trading below the value of their BTC holdings and arguing that aggressive Bitcoin promotion by political and financial interests contrasts with stronger demand for physical gold.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: AI insiders reportedly launch 'Poison Fountain' project to sabotage training data
items.summary: A small group of anonymous AI industry insiders has begun seeding subtly incorrect code and content online via a project dubbed 'Poison Fountain' to poison web-scraped training data used by large AI models, aiming to degrade model quality and push back against what they see as dangerous AI deployments.[1] The effort is inspired by recent academic work showing that even a small number of malicious documents can significantly harm models, and is framed against broader concerns about 'model collapse' as systems increasingly train on AI-generated data.[1]

items.title: Google pulls AI Overviews for some liver test medical queries after accuracy concerns
items.summary: Google has removed its AI Overviews from certain medical search queries related to normal liver blood test ranges after a Guardian investigation found the summaries could present misleading ranges that ignore factors such as age, sex, ethnicity, and nationality.[3] The company says it is making broad improvements and that internal clinicians deemed many highlighted answers not inaccurate, but critics argue selective removals do not address systemic risks of health-related AI Overviews.[3]

items.title: New practical guide demonstrates targeted data poisoning attacks on deep learning models
items.summary: Marktechpost has published a coding tutorial showing how to execute targeted data poisoning on a CIFAR-10 image classifier by flipping labels for a subset of samples, training both clean and poisoned ResNet-based models side by side to analyze the impact.[4] The guide illustrates how subtle label corruption can cause systematic misclassification of specific classes without drastically degrading overall accuracy, underscoring real-world risks to ML systems and the need for robust data provenance and monitoring.[4]

items.title: Supermicro, NVIDIA, and partners unveil edge AI 'intelligent in-store' retail solutions
items.summary: Supermicro announced new intelligent in-store retail solutions built on its edge infrastructure and NVIDIA accelerated AI, enabling AI agents in kiosks, holograms, and video-analytics systems to power customer interactions and operational insights in physical stores.[5] Partners including Wobot AI, LiveX AI, and ALLSIDES are using these platforms for video AI agents, human-like customer-facing AI interfaces, and 3D digital twin data layers that support training robots, optimizing store layouts, and improving retail decision-making.[5]

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.
